headline: Ford (NYSE:F) Reports Bullish Q2
summary: Automotive manufacturer Ford (NYSE:F) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 5% year on year to $50.18 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.37 per share was 11.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Ford CEO on Earnings, EV Offerings, Tariffs
summary: Ford Motor Co. says profits will fall as much as 36% this year due to President Donald Trump's tariffs. Ford CEO Jim Farley talks about that, earnings, electric vehicles and expanding its hybrid lineup. Earnings of 37 cents a share did beat Wall Street estimates. Farley is on "Bloomberg The Close."

raw.headline: Ford CEO on Earnings, EV Offerings, Tariffs

headline: Ford posts Q2 beat, but warns of tariff impact
summary: Ford (F) reported second quarter results that topped Wall Street estimates on both the top and bottom lines. However, the automaker warned that it expects to take a $2 billion hit from auto tariffs this year. Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian breaks down the results in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Ford trims full-year profit view as tariffs weigh
summary: Investing.com -- Ford Motor Company (NYSE:F) lowered its full-year earnings outlook due to a $2 billion net headwind from tariffs. Shares of the company were down 3% in aftermarket trading. The company now expects adjusted EBIT of $6.5 billion to $7.5 billion for 2025, down from its earlier range of $7 billion to $8.5 billion. The new forecast reflects a $3 billion hit from tariffs, which is partially offset by $1 billion in recovery measures.The automaker topped quarterly profit and revenue est

headline: Ford Takes $800 Million Tariff Hit, Posts First Loss Since 2023
summary: The hit helped wipe out the company’s net profit, leading to its first quarterly loss since 2023.  “They’ve made it clear that Ford as the most American automaker should not be disadvantaged,” finance chief  Sherry House  said.  The company reported a net loss of $29 million, compared with $1.8 billion in net income a year ago.

raw.headline: Ford Takes $800 Million Tariff Hit, Posts First Loss Since 2023
raw.summary: The hit helped wipe out the company’s net profit, leading to its first quarterly loss since 2023.  “They’ve made it clear that Ford as the most American automaker should not be disadvantaged,” finance chief  Sherry House  said.  The company reported a net loss of $29 million, compared with $1.8 billion in net income a year ago.

headline: Ford raises projected tariff hit to results, shares drop 3%
summary: DETROIT (Reuters) -Ford Motor said on Wednesday that U.S. tariffs on imported vehicles, as well as on steel and aluminum, will likely cost more than expected for the year, and the automaker's shares slid about 3% in after-market trading.  Ford reported that second-quarter results took an $800-million hit from tariffs, a less pronounced impact than some of its U.S. rivals thanks to Ford's strong domestic manufacturing base.  For the full year, the automaker lifted the higher range of its projected hit to gross revenues from tariffs by $500 million, to $3 billion.

raw.headline: Ford raises projected tariff hit to results, shares drop 3%
raw.summary: DETROIT (Reuters) -Ford Motor said on Wednesday that U.S. tariffs on imported vehicles, as well as on steel and aluminum, will likely cost more than expected for the year, and the automaker's shares slid about 3% in after-market trading.  Ford reported that second-quarter results took an $800-million hit from tariffs, a less pronounced impact than some of its U.S. rivals thanks to Ford's strong domestic manufacturing base.  For the full year, the automaker lifted the higher range of its projected hit to gross revenues from tariffs by $500 million, to $3 billion.

headline: Ford reports Q2 earnings beat but takes $800M tariff hit
summary: Ford posted an earnings and revenue beat for the second quarter and reinstated full-year guidance, but upped its full-year tariff exposure after seeing $800 million in tariff costs in Q2 alone.

raw.headline: Ford reports Q2 earnings beat but takes $800M tariff hit

headline: Ford Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: DEARBORN, Mich., July 30, 2025--Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F) today reported second quarter 2025 financial results and reinstated full-year 2025 guidance. The company also declared a third-quarter regular dividend of 15 cents per share, payable on Sept. 2 to shareholders of record at the close of business on Aug. 11. Visit the company’s Investor Relations website at shareholder.ford.com to view the earnings release, earnings presentation and other supporting material.

Visit the company’s Investor Relations website at shareholder.ford.com to view the earnings release, earnings presentation and other supporting material.

headline: Ford Motor (F) Appoints Alicia Boler Davis As President Of Ford Pro
summary: Ford Motor (F) recently announced an executive leadership transition, with Alicia Boler Davis set to lead Ford Pro beginning October 1, 2025. Her extensive background at Alto Pharmacy, Amazon, and General Motors could strengthen Ford's strategic direction, contributing to its recent 10.7% share price increase over the last quarter. Despite this change, broader market trends such as optimism around corporate earnings, including major tech company results, and stable interest rates, suggest...

headline: Illinois Tool Works lifts 2025 profit forecast betting on price hikes
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's expansive tariffs have driven up costs of raw materials, including steel and aluminum, squeezing margins for industrial equipment makers and forcing them to raise prices to offset the impact.  Illinois Tool Works said in May that localized production, flexible operations and a diversified business mix have helped it navigate economic uncertainty.  Illinois Tool Works now expects 2025 profit to be in the range of $10.35 to $10.55 per share, compared with its prior projection of $10.15 to $10.55 per share.

raw.headline: Illinois Tool Works lifts 2025 profit forecast betting on price hikes

Illinois Tool Works said in May that localized production, flexible operations and a diversified business mix have helped it navigate economic uncertainty.  Illinois Tool Works now expects 2025 profit to be in the range of $10.35 to $10.55 per share, compared with its prior projection of $10.15 to $10.55 per share.

headline: Alicia Boler Davis, Veteran Leader in Autos, Tech, Logistics and Customer Experience, Named President of Ford Pro
summary: DEARBORN, Mich., July 30, 2025--Ford Motor Company announced today that Alicia Boler Davis, an accomplished executive with more than 30 years of experience in automotive, technology, and customer experience, has been named president of Ford Pro, effective Oct. 1. She succeeds Andrew Frick, who has served as interim leader of Ford Pro since last year and will continue to lead Ford Blue and Ford Model e.
